summary: S Jonathan Blackmer was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents list Blackmer's name, position, salary, and pay period earnings. The documents indicate Blackmer was employed by the HSCA during the period when the committee was actively investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
significance: S Jonathan Blackmer's significance lies in their employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the specific role Blackmer played is not detailed in these documents, their presence on the payroll and certification reports indicates they were part of the team involved in the investigation.
